importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The planned opening date of the exhibition at CajaGranada Cultural Center in Granada, Spain, where the missing Picasso painting was supposed to be on display.
The day the article was published, and when the Spanish police officially announced the investigation into the disappearance of the Picasso painting.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period leading up to the exhibition opening, during which the painting was delivered and stored under video surveillance.
The time frame during which the delivery, transfer, and initial storage of the artworks occurred, with the painting missing during unpacking on Monday, October 10.

keyTakeAways: A Picasso painting titled 'Still Life with Guitar' (1919) went missing during its delivery to an exhibition at CajaGranada Cultural Center in Granada, Spain.
The painting was insured for 600,000 euros ($700,000), indicating its high value and significance in the art world.
The disappearance occurred during the unpacking process on Monday, October 10, 2025, after a scheduled delivery from Madrid.
All movements of the artworks were under continuous video surveillance, and no incidents were recorded over the weekend.
Spanish police are investigating the theft, and the painting has been reported to international databases of stolen artworks.
Picasso's works have historically been prime targets for theft due to their high market value and cultural significance.
Previous recovery cases of Picasso paintings—such as 'Portrait of Dora Maar' in 2019 and 'Head of a Woman' in 2021—demonstrate recurring patterns of theft and recovery.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 1919 gouache painting by Pablo Picasso, titled 'Still Life with Guitar,' went missing during its delivery to a temporary exhibition at the CajaGranada Cultural Center in Granada, Spain. The artwork, valued at 600,000 euros, was delivered from Madrid and stored under video surveillance during transit and unpacking, but was not found when staff began placing it on display on Monday, October 10, 2025. Spanish police have launched an investigation into the disappearance, which has been reported to international databases of stolen artworks. The case is significant due to Picasso's history of being a frequent target for art thieves, with several past recoveries in the Netherlands, Greece, and Belgium, highlighting a recurring pattern of theft and recovery of his valuable works.
title: Picasso painting goes missing en route to exhibition
